What is culture?
Unique traditions of a particular group
How is stereotype different from culture?
stereotype is often a negative belief about a group of people, that is not as universally true as their culture.
How do Western show respect, and Eastern cultures?
Shake hands vs bowing
What is halal food?
Food prepared according to Islamic dietary laws
Why do some Muslim women wear hijabs?
Religious requirement
What is the tango?
A passionate dance from Argentina
Name 3 major world religions
Christianity / Islam / Hinduism / Buddhism / Taoism / Judaism
What is Ramadan?
A holy month of fasting in Islam
What is Diwali?
The Hindu festival of lights
Is it a good gesture to tip in the USA?
No, it is almost compulsary. In Australia, it would be a good gesture.
What does Namaste mean in India?
A greeting meaning I bow to you.
What is the meaning of Inshallah?
In Arabic, it means If God wills, used commonly to express hope
Where does the word bazaar originate from?
market in the Middle Eastern country
What is an extended family?
A family that includes grandparents, aunts, uncles, etc
Is it only Asians that have parents and children live together until marriage?
No, as well as many Latin American and Mediterranean cultures.
What is a dowry?
Money or gifts given by the bride's family to the groom's/
What is the Australian slang for "friend"?
mate
What do some people call Australia's national day?
Australia Day / Invasion Day
What is Australia's famous type of coffee?
flat white, a stronger version of latte
What is the nick name for Melbourne Cup?
The race that stops a nation
What is a schoolies week in Australia?
A celebration for high school graduates, often at the beach.
What is considered rude in Australia?
Bragging / not saying please and thank you / not talking and laughing like crazy
What is tall poppy syndrome?
Criticizing people who show off or act superior, snobbish
What is the American dream?
The belief that anyone can succeed through hard work.
What is the second most widely spoken language in the US?
Spanish, by Mexicans in the US
Name the 12 Chinese Zodiac
rat / ox / tiger / rabbit / dragon / snake / horse / sheep / monkey / rooster / dog/ pig
What is the staple food in Northern China, and what is in the south?
Noodle vs Rice
Should you finish all your food in China, traditionally?
No, leaving a little shows you are full.
How is matcha differ from green tea?
matcha means powdered form of green tea
Is tipping expected in Japan?
No, and some will take offence if insisted
